headings: Learn how to use technology to influence the future of business.
Earn a Master’s Degree at the Same Time
What Can You Do With a Management Information Systems Degree?
Why Earn My MIS Degree at Angelo State?
paragraphs: Management information systems (MIS) professionals analyze data to help businesses and organizations gain maximum benefit from their investments in both technology and personnel. If you are interested in advanced technology and have a desire to use it to improve people’s lives, then a MIS degree could be for you.

In our wide-ranging STEM degree program, you’ll take classes in everything from applied business statistics, data analytics and web systems development - to networks, data communication, and system analysis and design. You can also gain practical experience through our robust internship program and by engaging with local businesses.
Contact Information
The Norris-Vincent College of Business is accredited by AACSB International.

You also have the option of applying for our integrated program that allows you to earn your B.B.A. in Management Information Systems and yourMaster of Business Administration(MBA) degree in as little as five years.

Our professional faculty bring real-world experience to the classroom and stay up to date on the latest trends and technology in business computer information systems. You’ll have the chance to work with them on high-level research projects, and you may also overlap with faculty in our Computer Science Department.
Management Faculty and Staff
ASU Distinguished ScholarshipsOur premier scholarships are awarded based on your academic achievement, and you don’t even have to apply. You are automatically considered once you are admitted to ASU.
General ScholarshipsWe offer over 600 different types of scholarships. You can apply for both our general scholarships and degree-specific scholarships with one application.
Blue and Gold GuaranteeIf you have financial need, you may qualify forfree tuitionto attend Angelo State.

Our graduates can expect to find immediate employment as network and computer systems administrators, IT technical support specialists, web administrators, software developers and business information officers.

Plus, the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics reports that employment opportunities for business computer information systems managers are expected to increase at a tremendous rate over the next 10 years, adding thousands of new jobs with median salaries of about $150,000 a year.
Explore Career Possibilities

You’ll have access to our smart classrooms complete with digital technology, and we also have our own fully-equipped computer lab. ASU also houses the state’s first Regional Security Operations Center with the latest in cybersecurity technology. You’ll also have access to all the services in ourCenter for Student Successto help you achieve your academic and professional goals.

We offer multiple opportunities for internships, and our internship coordinator can help you find the right one for you. You can join our chapter of the Delta Sigma Pi national business fraternity for networking and professional development. You can also compete in our student BizPitch Contest, and you can sharpen your management skills in our Housley Principled Leadership Program.

You can expand your knowledge of management practices in the international marketplace on our annual summer study abroad trip to Europe. You’ll visit cities in nine European countries that host numerous multinational corporations and other international organizations. You’ll also get to visit a variety of historical sites to truly broaden your horizons.

Take your education to the next level in theASU Honors Program. Through special courses, cultural events, research and community engagement, we’ll help you transform your intellectual and personal talents into marketable skills for your future. You’ll also have the opportunity to participate in prestigious internships, fellowships and other programs to reach your full potential.
Explore the Honors Advantage

OurFreshman Collegeis a one-stop resource for programs and services that help you transition into college life, improve your communication skills, and engage in active learning. You can also get academic help in theMath LabandWriting Center, receive peer mentoring and tutoring throughSupplemental Instruction, or set up onlinetutoringsessions.
If you want to go fast, go alone. But if you want to go far, go together.
ApplyVisit UsRequest Info

Col. Peter Lasch, B.B.A. & ROTC, Class of 1997

“Without the Carr Scholarship, I wouldn’t be where I am today. I definitely wouldn’t be a Ram, which is a major accomplishment in my life.”

Cesar Amezcua, B.B.A., Class of 2003

“Angelo State prepared me academically.”

Cesar Amezcua, B.B.A., Class of 2003

“The coursework advanced my ability to critically think, as well as my communication, written and verbal skills – all necessary for success in the military.”

Col. Peter Lasch, B.B.A. & ROTC, Class of 1997

“I have no doubt, had I not gone through the Angelo State business school myself, that I would be anywhere near where I am today. It’s an honor to own a San Angelo-based business and give back to the university who helped me grow into an entrepreneur. Knowing I can directly influence the next generation of business-owners is an incredible feeling.”

Blake Vincent, Class of 1996
